name: ngHover: Angular Hover Service
tagline: A small service I made to handle color changes when mouse is hovering on links.
body:
# ngHover: Angular Hover Service I made this AngularJS service to handle colors of links when they are changed by the user (example, with a colorpicker). The hover event can be tricky! ##### 1) Include the file. ``` ``` ##### 2) Use the service in a controller, and define some colors to be managed. ``` var app = angular.module('app', ['ngHover']); app.module('MainController', function($scope, ngHover) { // These values could be coming from a remote database. $scope.link.normal.text = '#CCCCCC'; $scope.link.hover.text = '#FFFFFF'; // Set up service with the value to be updated when mouse is over the link. ngHover.set($scope, 'linkNormalText', 'link.normal.text'); // Service will be used also in the view. $scope.hover = ngHover; }); ``` ##### 3) Probably, in your UI you have a colorpicker and the user can change colors. ``` ``` ##### 4) Use the service in the view in order to show updated colors. ```
A link with nice colors
``` ##### 5) You can handle any CSS property: Controller: ``` $scope.link.normal.background = '#FF0000'; $scope.link.normal.border = '#00FF00'; $scope.link.hover.background = '#0000FF'; $scope.link.hover.border = '#FF00FF'; ngHover.set($scope, 'linkNormalBackground', 'link.normal.background'); ngHover.set($scope, 'linkNormalBorder', 'link.normal.border'); ``` View: ``` A link with nice colors ``` ## To do - Rewrite in() and out() functions to avoid the second argument. This value could be established when the service is configured. - Avoid multiple calls to in() and out() when several CSS properties are used. ### Bugs? Comments? Just tell me! I'm an AngularJS new user, coming from Javascript an jQuery. Any comments would be appreciated! Regards, Cristian.
